import plotly.graph_objects as go
import plotly.io as pio
import pandas as pd
import math

# Force Plotly to use the classic renderer (not ES modules)
pio.renderers.default = "notebook_connected"

# ---------- shared dark layout ----------
BG = "#0f172a"
CARD = "rgba(30, 41, 59, 0.75)"
TEXT = "#e2e8f0"
MUTED = "#94a3b8"
GRID = "rgba(148, 163, 184, 0.12)"
FONT = "Inter, system-ui, sans-serif"
TITLE_FONT = "Space Grotesk, system-ui, sans-serif"
ACCENT = "#38bdf8"
DIM = "#334155"
SHOW = {"displayModeBar": False}

def styled(fig, title=""):
    fig.update_layout(
        title=dict(
            text=f"<b>{title}</b>" if title else "",
            font=dict(family=TITLE_FONT, size=22, color="#f8fafc"),
            x=0.5, xanchor="center", y=0.97, yanchor="top",
        ),
        paper_bgcolor=BG,
        plot_bgcolor=BG,
        font=dict(family=FONT, size=14, color=TEXT),
        margin=dict(l=10, r=10, t=60, b=10),
        autosize=True,
        showlegend=False,
        xaxis=dict(
            gridcolor=GRID, zerolinecolor=GRID,
            tickfont=dict(family=FONT, size=13, color=MUTED),
            title_font=dict(family=FONT, size=14, color=MUTED),
        ),
        yaxis=dict(
            gridcolor=GRID, zerolinecolor=GRID,
            tickfont=dict(family=FONT, size=13, color=MUTED),
            title_font=dict(family=FONT, size=14, color=MUTED),
        ),
        hoverlabel=dict(
            bgcolor=CARD, font_size=14, font_family=FONT,
            font_color=TEXT, bordercolor=GRID,
        ),
    )
    for trace in fig.data:
        if hasattr(trace, "textfont") and not isinstance(trace, go.Scatter):
            trace.textfont = dict(family=FONT, size=14, color="#f8fafc")
        if hasattr(trace, "insidetextfont"):
            trace.insidetextfont = dict(family=FONT, size=13, color="#f8fafc")
        if hasattr(trace, "outsidetextfont"):
            trace.outsidetextfont = dict(family=FONT, size=14, color=TEXT)
    return fig

def hl(names, colors, highlight):
    """Return colors: original for names in highlight, DIM for rest."""
    return [c if n in highlight else DIM for n, c in zip(names, colors)]

# ---------- chart helpers ----------

def make_hbar(df, y_col, x_col, colors, text_vals, title):
    fig = go.Figure()
    fig.add_trace(go.Bar(
        y=df[y_col], x=df[x_col], orientation="h",
        marker_color=colors, text=text_vals,
        textposition="inside", insidetextanchor="middle",
        textfont=dict(family=FONT, size=14, color="#f8fafc"),
    ))
    styled(fig, title)
    fig.update_layout(width=350, yaxis=dict(autorange="reversed"))
    fig.show(config=SHOW)


def make_pie(df, label_col, value_col, colors, title,
             center="", tmpl="<b>%{label}</b><br>%{value:,}"):
    fig = go.Figure()
    fig.add_trace(go.Pie(
        labels=df[label_col], values=df[value_col],
        marker_colors=colors, hole=0.5, sort=False,
        texttemplate=tmpl,
        textfont=dict(family=FONT, size=14, color="#f8fafc"),
        insidetextfont=dict(family=FONT, size=13, color="#f8fafc"),
        outsidetextfont=dict(family=FONT, size=13, color=TEXT),
    ))
    styled(fig, title)
    if center:
        fig.update_layout(annotations=[dict(
            text=center, x=0.5, y=0.5, showarrow=False,
            font=dict(family=TITLE_FONT, color=ACCENT, size=18))])
    fig.update_layout(width=350)
    fig.show(config=SHOW)

def make_treemap(df, label_col, value_col, colors, title):
    fig = go.Figure()
    fig.add_trace(go.Treemap(
        labels=df[label_col], parents=[""] * len(df),
        values=df[value_col], marker_colors=colors,
        texttemplate="<b>%{label}</b><br>%{value} votos",
        textfont=dict(family=FONT, size=14),
        pathbar=dict(textfont=dict(family=FONT, size=12)),
    ))
    styled(fig, title)
    fig.update_layout(width=350)
    fig.show(config=SHOW)

colors_cloud = ["#38bdf8","#f472b6","#a78bfa","#34d399","#fbbf24","#818cf8",
                "#22d3ee","#fb923c","#86efac","#f472b6","#38bdf8","#fbbf24",
                "#a78bfa","#34d399","#818cf8","#22d3ee","#f87171","#c084fc",
                "#86efac","#fb923c","#67e8f9","#fbbf24","#f472b6","#38bdf8",
                "#34d399","#a78bfa","#818cf8","#fbbf24","#22d3ee","#f87171"]

def make_wordcloud(highlight_words=None):
    fig = go.Figure()
    max_m = max(m for _, m in words_data)
    min_m = min(m for _, m in words_data)
    # Two passes: dimmed first, highlighted on top
    for is_highlight_pass in (False, True):
        for i, (word, mentions) in enumerate(words_data):
            is_hl = highlight_words is None or word in highlight_words
            if is_hl != is_highlight_pass:
                continue
            angle = i * 0.85
            radius = 0.8 + i * 0.45
            frac = (mentions - min_m) / (max_m - min_m)
            color = colors_cloud[i % len(colors_cloud)] if is_hl else DIM
            fig.add_trace(go.Scatter(
                x=[radius * math.cos(angle)],
                y=[radius * math.sin(angle) * 0.7],
                mode="text", text=[word],
                textfont=dict(family=TITLE_FONT, size=10 + frac * 28, color=color),
                hovertemplate=f"{word}: {mentions} menciones<extra></extra>",
                showlegend=False,
            ))
    styled(fig, "Palabras por Frecuencia")
    fig.update_layout(width=350, xaxis=dict(visible=False),
                      yaxis=dict(visible=False, scaleanchor="x"))
    fig.show(config=SHOW)

def make_bubble(df, cat_col, val_col, colors, title):
    fig = go.Figure()
    fig.add_trace(go.Scatter(
        x=df[val_col], y=df[cat_col],
        mode="markers+text",
        marker=dict(size=df[val_col] * 1.8, color=colors,
                    opacity=0.75, line=dict(color="rgba(148,163,184,0.3)", width=1)),
        text=[f"<b>{v}</b>" for v in df[val_col]],
        textposition="middle center",
        textfont=dict(family=TITLE_FONT, size=16, color="#f8fafc"),
    ))
    styled(fig, title)
    fig.update_layout(width=350, yaxis=dict(autorange="reversed"))
    fig.show(config=SHOW)

## Tres Palabras Sobre los ODS

:::{.cr-section layout="overlay-center"}

**"Nombra tres palabras cuando piensas en los ODS."** @cr-w-futuro

[**Futuro**]{style="color:#38bdf8"} --- mencionada **48 veces**. Lo que nos mueve es lo que viene después. @cr-w-futuro

[**Esperanza**]{style="color:#f472b6"} --- **44 veces**. El combustible que no se agota. @cr-w-esperanza

[**Acción**]{style="color:#a78bfa"} --- **42 veces**. Las palabras sin acción son solo ruido. @cr-w-accion

[**Juntos**]{style="color:#34d399"} --- **40 veces**. Nadie cambia el mundo solo. @cr-w-juntos

[**Planeta**]{style="color:#fbbf24"} --- **38 veces**. Nuestra casa compartida, la única que tenemos. @cr-w-planeta

[**Cambio**]{style="color:#818cf8"} --- **36 veces**. La razón por la que estamos aquí. @cr-w-cambio

[**Justicia**]{style="color:#22d3ee"} --- **34 veces**. En el corazón de la sostenibilidad. @cr-w-justicia

[**Clima**]{style="color:#fb923c"} --- **33 veces**. El desafío de nuestra generación. @cr-w-clima

Y después: [**Igualdad**]{style="color:#fbbf24"}, [**Innovación**]{style="color:#a78bfa"}, [**Comunidad**]{style="color:#34d399"} y muchas más --- **30 palabras** que dibujan quiénes somos. @cr-w-all
